result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:03 AM  Assistant District Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court for Kristie Ann Hoyer.  Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer in Court.  Court addresses Arraignment in 22CF32.  Court confirms Information received, advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Bond remains.  11:04 AM  Court addresses Arraignment in 22CF68.   Court confirms Information received, advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Bond remains.  Adjourned at 11:08 AM

10:34 AM  Assistant District Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court for Kristie Ann Hoyer.  Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer in Court.  22CF32, 22CF63 and 22CF68 set for Preliminary Hearing.  22CM73 set for Status.  Atty. Nelson requests to address Preliminary Hearings chronologically.  22CF32 addressed.  S/T Pierce County Deputy Nicholas Jacobsen.  Direct by ADA Schieffer.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Nelson.  Deputy released.  State makes argument and requests probable cause finding and bind over.  Atty. Nelson states no argument for today's purposes.  Court makes findings; finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Court will address Information/Arraignment on cases at the end of all hearings.  10:43 AM  Court proceeds to PH on 22CF63.  State requests Court take judicial notice of bond and conditions in 22CF32.  Court takes judicial notice.  S/T Pierce County Deputy Rick Huneke.  Direct by ADA Schieffer.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Nelson.  Deputy released.  State makes argument and requests probable cause finding and bind over.  Atty. Nelson states argument.  ADA Schieffer responds.  Atty. Nelson rebuts.  Court makes findings; does not find probable cause as to Defendant and dismisses case w/o pred.  10:54 AM  Court proceeds to PH on 22CF68.  S/T Pierce County Patrol Sergeant Cole Clements.  Direct by ADA Schieffer.  Defendant identified.  ADA Schieffer requests Court take judicial notice of the bond, Court takes judicial notice.  Cross by Atty. Nelson.  Deputy released.  State makes argument and requests probable cause finding and bind over.  Atty. Nelson states no argument for today's purposes.  Court makes findings; finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.

3:07 PM Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF68, 22CF63, 22CF32 and 22CM73 (RW). Court questions non-appearance, she was in Anoka County Jail. Court will quash the warrants. ADA Walker is requesting a $1,500.00 CB on 22CF32, Atty Nelson argues. Court will reinstate bonds on each case. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:15 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif
Extradite Adj. States     JRG signed 7/5/22 - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

1:32 PM Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer does not appear in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF32, 22CF63, 22CF68 (PH) and 22CM73 (STC). The felonies were set for a PH. Atty Nelson states DE is in custody in Anoka County Minnesota. ADA Schieffer was able to call off Law Enforcement but is requesting a warrant Adj. States. Atty Nelson is requesting to stay the warrant, ADA Schieffer argues. Court will authorize warrants Adj. States for the felonies and Statewide for 22CM73. Court adjourned at 1:35 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:24 PM Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer appears in custody via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF32, 22CF63, 22CF68, 22CM73.  Court questions nonappearance.  Atty. Nelson advises Defendant was picked up in Washingon County.  State does not object to quashing warrants.  Does not object to reinstating bonds in 22CF63, 22CF68, 22CM73.  Requests cash bond w/conditions in 22CF32.  Court questions conditions.  DA Hatch requests AS and NPOC, notes prior missed appearances, Officers have appeared and costs of $240 owed.  Atty. Nelson states argument and requests signature bond reinstated.  Court notes prior assessment of costs due to FTA on 05/16, will be determined at later time.  Court reinstates bonds in each case.  Court sets felonys for PH, one hour.  Court questions address and phone.  Adjourned at 3:32 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

04:16 PM Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF32, 22CF63 and 22CF68 set for PH. 22CM73 trailing. ADA Schieffer requests a warrant on each case; felonies are extraditible adjoining states, misdemeanor statewide. Atty Nelson; no information. Court authorizes warrants as requested.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:05 AM Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer appears does not appear in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF68, 22CF63, 22CF32 (PH) and 22CM73 (STC). Atty Nelson states DE has tested positive for covid and would not appear. ADA Schieffer is asking for costs of the 3 Officers present at $80.00 each. Court will not issue warrants but will access costs of $80.00 on each of the felonies. Attorneys to meet with JA to reschedule. Court adjourned at 10:08 am.

3:09 PM Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS & Not to Possess, no objection. Court so orders. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:17 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
